Class DoorGame

java.lang.Object
DoorGame
public class DoorGame extends Object
The class DoorGame is responsible for running simulations of the Monty Hall Door problem.
Author:
Rachel Hussmann

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    ArrayList<Double>
    runGame(int trials)
    The runGame method runs the door game, adding up the amount of wins when the door choice is kept the same and then when it is switched.
    void
    stayTrials(int trials)
    The stayTrials method runs the trials where the person keeps their original choice every time.
    void
    switchTrials(int trials)
    The switchTrials method runs the trials where the person switches their choice every time.

      public DoorGame()

  • Method Details

    • runGame

      public ArrayList<Double> runGame(int trials)
      The runGame method runs the door game, adding up the amount of wins when the door choice is kept the same and then when it is switched.
      Parameters:
      trials - The number of trials the user would like to run for both trial types.
      Returns:
      This method returns an ArrayList of doubles associated with the percentages of wins for both types of trials.

    • stayTrials

      public void stayTrials(int trials)
      The stayTrials method runs the trials where the person keeps their original choice every time.
      Parameters:
      trials - The number of trials to be run

    • switchTrials

      public void switchTrials(int trials)
      The switchTrials method runs the trials where the person switches their choice every time.
      Parameters:
      trials - The number of trials to be run
